title: Coulomb excitation of 202Rn
abstractText: A remarkable feature of the atomic nucleus is the ability for it to take on different shapes at small cost in energy. This phenomenon is known as nuclear shape coexistence and understanding the fine balance between nuclear shapes is a challenge to state-of-the-art nuclear models. We propose to make a stringent test of shape coexistence in the light radon nuclei using Coulomb excitation at the REX-ISOLDE facility in CERN.
impactText: The work has been disseminated at conferences and a paper is in preparation.
findingsText: We studied Coulomb excitation of 202Rn at REX-ISOLDE in CERN as a means of exploring nuclear shape coexistence. The experiment was successful and a paper is in preparation. It will encourage further work in this area. Education
